definition: to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress

sentences.english: He thought of here, go down the windows fly.
sentences.chinese: 他想到这儿，顺着窗户飞了下去。

sentences.english: The rain flowed into the low-lying land.
sentences.chinese: 雨水都顺着山势流到了塘坳里。

sentences.english: Follow this road and turn left Happy Road.
sentences.chinese: 顺着这条街走，然后左拐进入快乐路。

sentences.english: I'm driving collectively a country roadvertising oned I'm completely lost.
sentences.chinese: 我开车顺着一条乡下小路前行，我一经全体迷路了。

sentences.english: A single tear ran down my cheek.
sentences.chinese: 一滴眼泪顺着我的脸颊流下来。

sentences.english: Water was leaking from pipe in the bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 水顺着管子渗到浴室里。

sentences.english: She let her hair loose and it fell around her shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 她的头发一解开，便顺着肩膀垂了下来。

sentences.english: It's really interesting that palindromes can be read in both directions.
sentences.chinese: 回文诗顺着倒着都能念，真有意思。

sentences.english: You can separate the stamps along the perforated line.
sentences.chinese: 你可以顺着齿孔线把邮票撕开。

sentences.english: The wheel travels along this bar.
sentences.chinese: 轮子顺着这根滑竿移动。

sentences.english: But my problem had always been that I went along with whatever my father wanted.
sentences.chinese: 但这一直都是我的问题，我一向顺着父亲的意思来。

sentences.english: He followed it until he was in sight of the homestead.
sentences.chinese: 他顺着路一直走，直到看见宅基地。

sentences.english: These beetles make sausage-shaped brood chambers along the tunnels.
sentences.chinese: 这些甲虫顺着地道建造香肠形状的产房。

sentences.english: Follow this road to the corner.
sentences.chinese: 顺着这条路走到拐角处。

sentences.english: We can sail, we can sail with the orinoco flow.
sentences.chinese: 让我们，去远航，顺着奥里诺科流。

definition: to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous
to detour/to bypass/to circumvent/to avoid/to wind around (of a road etc)
along/to follow (a line, tradition etc)/to carry on/to trim (a border with braid, tape etc)/border/edge
to get into/to dig into (studies, job etc)/to squeeze into
to let drip/to trickle down/to shed (tears)
